How does the synthesis method of [Zn­(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest contribute to its unique properties?

What challenges are associated with measuring the crystal structure of [Zn­(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest under high pressure?

What does the term 'negative area compressibility' (NAC) specifically refer to in the context of [Zn­(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: NAC refers to the material's unique ability to expand in two directions when hydrostatically compressed, a rare and counterintuitive property.
